message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,200,000. It's a valuable asset, and I believe this price reflects its worth. I'm confident it will be a valuable addition to your operations.
I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I'm not willing to pay $1,200,000. I'm willing to pay $900,000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering its worth to me.

Bob, I understand your position, but $900,000 simply doesn't cover the value of this product. I'm willing to come down to $1,050,000, a price that reflects a fair compromise. This is my final offer, and I believe it's a good deal for both of us.

I understand your perspective, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $975,000 for the product. I think this is a reasonable compromise, and I'm willing to make a deal at this price.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I'm willing to drop my price to $1,025,000. This is a significant concession on my part, and I believe it's a fair price considering the value of the product.  Let's make this deal happen.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer $1,012,500 for the product. I think this is a reasonable compromise, and I'm willing to make a deal at this price.
